name: Clarion Collection Hotel With

reviews.text: A great little hotel - the 'free' food is a terrific bonus. All staff pleasant and helpful.We overlooked the harbour and across to the Cathedral - so a great view. Spotlessly clean.We decided to go on lights chasing tours two nights running - and as activity was low it was worth doing. First night with a nearby hotel coach trip with Arctic Adventures - the second night with Gunner Hildonen - which I'd recommend, he knows his stuff!
reviews.title: Great Hospitality!

reviews.text: We upgraded to a harbour/fjord facing room on arrival and I'm really glad we did, the view was stunning. Great breakfast selection, free tea coffee and hot chocolate all day, make your own waffles every day 3-6 (also free) and even a complementary evening buffet that you are welcome to enjoy too. Norway is not a cheap country and these added touches made it a much more affordable stay for us. We booked a the northern lights chase tour via Rica Ishavshotel and were lucky enough to see the aurora arc across the sky. The hotel is in easy walking distance of everything in the town, thoroughly recommended!
reviews.title: Fab location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 10 days in Dec and as choice members were upgraded from a moderate double room to a superior double room with harbour view, which was fantastic. The included food helped with budgeting and was of a good quality. The dining room is basic with wipe clean tables, mainly in rows, but this encourages friendliness between guests, and shared experiences. The breakfast included a large choice of cold meats, cheese, cereal and fruit with some hot food. My husband liked the breakfasts that included baked beans best! The waffles were fun to make and tasty. Some reviewers have complained about the queue, but the waffle maker is available from 3 to 6 so either take a hot drink into the TV room and wait, come back a bit later when the queue has gone down or join the queue, talk to your fellow guests and probably pick up some tips on where to visit. The 'light supper' is available from 6 to 9 and includes soup, salad, main course (no choice), dessert, cheese and biscuits - a veritable feast! When we had an evening tour, (which all started at 6:30, five minutes away at either Rica or Radisson) we went down 5 mins early got our cutlery and drinks and had time to have either a soup and a sandwich or a salad before we went out. On evenings we weren't on a trip we went down about 7(to give the trippers time to eat) and had a leisurely meal before going for a walk to the lake to look for the lights. (Take a flask and a headlight or torch). We were lucky to see the lights most evenings. If you want a friendly hotel which is in a good position, and good value for money pick this hotel. If you want a hotel with waiter service, individual tables and tablecloths it is probably not for you.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel

reviews.text: In the always expensive Scandinavia, the great food that you can have bundled with the room will save you. It is not only a great bargain, but creates a friendly living room environment to relax outside of your room.
reviews.title: Great food and location

reviews.text: The staff was excellent and the rooms were nice. Not very high end, but efficient and clean. I cannot think of another place to stay in the city after living there for 5 days.
reviews.title: Great location and a good bargain
Great location
reviews.text: Not the best hotel in the world, but certainly a good one. Friendly and helpfully staff. Comfortable beds and rooms. Decent breakfast and the availability of endless coffee and tea when you come in from the cold was a great bonus. If you are in Tromso, the chances are you are out sight seeing most of the time so you don't need all the fancy stuff you get in some hotels. I would recommend the hotel if you are stopping for 3 to 5 days of sight seeing. It's not the Ritz, but it does the job at a sensible price and the location on the waters edge is great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews on here and we weren't disappointed. The Clarion With is a gem of a hotel situated right on the harbour and within easy walking distance of everywhere in Tromso. Unlike the other hotels, the architecture blends with that of the rest of the town and the interior has a nautical design.
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you catch the airport bus, it will stop outside Hotel Rica (not to be confused with the Rica Grand). The With (Norwegians don't pronounce the 'h') is a one minute walk, facing straight ahead when you get off the bus, along the boardwalk. A kind lady off our flight told us that a return ticket for the bus is cheaper, so we paid 100 NOK each for a return, saving a total of 60 NOK on single fares for us both.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was easy and we were able to catch the very end of dinner, but if we'd arrived later the staff would have provided us with something. We chose to pay 10 NOK extra per night for a harbour-facing room; the views were stunning and we were glad we did, though the harbour can get a little noisy at times. One boat, a Russian sailing boat called Peter I, kept us awake until after 4am on our second night by blasting music whilst the crew danced on the roof. They returned two days later and this time we contacted reception, who promptly called the police. The noise had stopped within the hour. We wished we'd done the same on the first night!
reviews.title: Great Location,Comfortable and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The major - and it really is MAJOR - plus of staying at the Clarion is the food. The dining room is open 24/7 for hot drinks, chilled water, fresh milk and fruit. They even provide Starbucks-esque take-away cups. Also included in the price of the room is breakfast, afternoon waffles and an evening meal.
reviews.title: Fantastic value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In expensive Norway, this hotel was an absolute gem! Not only was it neat and clean, it was in an awesome location and the staff were fantastic! The jewel in the crown though was the included breakfast ("sure you can make some rolls and take them with you for lunch!") followed by free waffles from 3-6pm followed by... yes, seriously... free dinner from 6-10pm! Can you believe it?!?! Not only this, but the staff did a whole bag of washing for us for free too!! Awesome, awesome, awesome. The money we saved on food, we spent on a dog sled tour which is one of the most amazing things I have ever done. All I can say is, go to Tromso, go dog sledding, see the northern lights, stay at the CCH With.
reviews.title: Must must must stay here in Tromso

reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 day stay. The food, staff and accomodation were all great. Couldn't fault the buffet with fresh fruit available all day The heated floors in the bathrooms a real bonus to dry your boots out after a day in the snow.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I spent 3 days in this hotel and was surprised at the quality of it. It is probably the fifth ranked hotel in tromso yet, in view of it's price and the fact that during the day hot drinks and food is supplied, it ranks number 1 in my book.
reviews.title: Fine hotel with extras free

reviews.text: All hotels in Norway are more than normal prices, and, in addition, if you want anything beyond their breakfast then you pay for it.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.text: No such rule in this hotel. Hot drinks, waffles and biscuits appear during the day and are all complimentary.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very close to other hotels such as the Radisson and the Rica Ishabel and is well placed for walking into town and enjoying views of the harbour. Most of the tour buses including the airport bus stop nearby. It is a three star hotel so not very luxurious but very comfortable and welcoming.
reviews.title: friendly Warm Atmosphere

reviews.text: The best thing about is hotel is the food. There is a good selection for breakfast, waffles in the afternoon and the supper from 6 - 9pm is more like a dinner where they provide soup, a different main dish each day with potatoes/rice and a variety of salads. The tables are arranged in rows and you can choose to sit by yourself or join others to chat. Tromso is very expensive and we saved a fortune by eating in the hotel where the quality of the food was excellent.
reviews.title: Very Good hotel

reviews.text: The superior rooms are great and they provide coffee/tea, toiletries and a fair amount of space with a seating area. The shower was brilliant. These rooms also have a view over the bridge and fjord which is all lit up during darkness. The staff are friendly and always willing to help and advise.
reviews.title: OK hotel but staff, perks and location make up for everything.

reviews.text: The only negative point is that there is no cosy bar. You can order drinks at the reception desk and have them in the small sitting room or the breakfast room. Based on the high price of the drinks (€9 for a glass of wine) you won't need the bar very often!
reviews.title: Can not understand why one would stay anywhere else. A Perfect stay.

reviews.text: I stayed two good and restful nights in this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and feel warm! The staff was attentive and friendly, ready for our arrival for an express check-in! The hotel is well located near the harbor and within walking distance from several restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Great service and location

description: Clarion Collection Hotel With is perfectly located in the harbor of the city center. Here you are only 50 meters away from the main street of Tromsø, close to restaurants and shopping.At all Clarion Collection Hotels the guests have included breakfast, waffles from 15:00(3pm)to 18:00(6pm) and light evening buffet from 18:00(6pm) to 21:00(9pm). The light evening buffet consists of one hot soup, one hot dish and bread. Not a big dinner buffet, but for most of our guests a really satisfying dinner. This makes Clarion Collection Hotel With a really cheap alternative for tourists visiting Tromsø.We also offer a relax room with sauna and a steam room at the top of the hotel. Welcome to a warm and friendly hotel where you can feel at home.
